articles.title: Building a new multi-species model
articles.description:
Here you will learn how to set up a multi-species mizer model, starting from
a given set of species parameters.

articles.title: Online mizer course
articles.contents:
2022 August 8-26
Size
based ecosystem models with the R package mizer and applications for
coastal and inland ecosystems
Please join us for an online course to learn about the principles of
size based community and ecosystem modelling, implementation of these
principles in the R package mizer, learn about adaptation of mizer for
shallow ecosystems with multiple resources, and learn how to build a new
model with your own or example data
The course consistes of the following tutorials:
Introduction to the mizer
course
Introduction to the mizer
model
Size spectra from
observations
Single-species
size-spectrum dynamics
Multi-species
size-spectrum dynamics
Using a model to explore the
consequences of change
Building a new multi-species
model
Finding species
parameters
Setting up multiple
resources
The course is led by Gustav Delius (University of York, UK) and Asta
Audzijonyte (Nature Research Centre, Lithuania & University of
Tasmania, Australia). Invited speakers include Ken Haste Andersen, Julia
Blanchard and others
Participation is free. If you are interested in this course and would
like to continue receiving information about it, please register
here
If you need more information, please contact us at info@fishsizeproject.org or comment below.

articles.title: Introduction to the mizer course
articles.description:
Here you will learn how the course is organised and how you will interact
with the tutorials and with the other participants. This will include
instructions on installing and setting up the necessary tools.

articles.title: Introduction to the mizer model
articles.description:
Here you will learn about the basic ideas underlying dynamic 
size-spectrum modelling with mizer. This includes a guest-lecture by
Ken Andersen.

articles.title: Setting up multiple resources
articles.description:
Here you will learn how to set up a mizer model with multiple size-structured
resources.

articles.title: Size spectra from observations
articles.description:
Here you will take observational data and plot the resulting size spectra for
the community and for individual species.

articles.title: Using a model to explore the consequences of change
articles.description:
Here you will learn how to explore the effects of changing parameters on
an existing mizer model. This will include a guest lecture by 
Julia Blanchard

articles.title: Finding species parameters
articles.description:
Here you will learn how to find appropriate values for the species parameters
needed to set up your own mizer model.
